TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MsmqIntegrationBinding extends System.ServiceModel.MsmqBindingBase

Docs.summary: The class maps Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) messages to Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This binding can be used to enable [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] applications to send and receive messages to and from existing MSMQ applications that use COM, native C++ APIs or the types defined in the <xref:System.Messaging> namespace.
## Examples The following configuration file snippet illustrates how to configure the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBinding> binding on the client:
The following configuration file snippet illustrates how to configure the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBinding> binding on the service:
[!code-csharp[S_MSMQToWCF#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_msmqtowcf/cs/service.cs#1)] [!code-vb[S_MSMQToWCF#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_msmqtowcf/vb/service.vb#1)]
The following code illustrates how to use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBinding> binding on the service programmatically:
[!code-csharp[S_MSMQToWCF#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_msmqtowcf/cs/service.cs#2)] [!code-vb[S_MSMQToWCF#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_msmqtowcf/vb/service.vb#2)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method enables you to instantiate a new instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBinding> and pass in a security mode.
## Examples The following code illustrates how to instantiate an instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBinding> binding, specifying the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationSecurityMode>:
[!code-csharp[S_WCFToMsmq#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_wcftomsmq/cs/snippets.cs#5)] [!code-vb[S_WCFToMsmq#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_wcftomsmq/vb/snippets.vb#5)]

Docs.exception: The value is not within the range of values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string configurationName) cil managed

Docs.param: The value of the attribute that identifies the element whose settings are used to initialize the binding.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the settings of a specified configuration binding element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method allows you to place the binding settings in a configuration file but add the actual binding in code.
## Examples The following code shows how to create an instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBinding> binding and initialize it by passing in the name of the binding element:

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationSecurity> encapsulates Message Queuing (MSMQ) transport security settings.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the serialization format to be used to serialize or deserialize the message.
Docs.value: A object that represents the type of serialization to use.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property returns an enumeration value that specifies how a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] message will be serialized and deserialized. For more information, see <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat>.
## Examples The following code illustrates how to set the serialization format on an instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBinding> class:
[!code-csharp[S_WCFToMsmq#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_wcftomsmq/cs/client.cs#4)]

Docs.returns: if security information should be serialized; otherwise .
